description.narrative: The Asian Development Fund (ADF) bridges the development gap in Asia and the Pacific, home to both the world's fast-rising and most vulnerable economies. ADF is a major instrument of concessional financing that has supported equitable and sustainable development in the region since 1973. Funded by ADB's member countries, it offers loans at very low interest rates as well as grants to help reduce poverty in ADB's poorest member countries. Funding under this initiative supports Australia's commitment to the Asian Development Bank's (ADB) concessional loan facility, the Asian Development Fund (ADF). The Australian Government will contribute to the 9th replenishment of the ADF representing 6.49 per cent burden share. The ADF is the concessional financing arm of the ADB and provides assistance to the poorest developing countries in the region in the form of highly concessional loans and grants. The total value of this initiative is $332.8 million over 8 years, starting 2009-10.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
